g601.definition: [ἀποκαλύπτω] from {{g575}} and {{g2572}}; to take off the cover, i.e. disclose

g603.definition: [ἀποκαραδοκία] from a comparative of {{g575}} and a compound of κάρα (the head) and {{g1380}} (in the sense of watching); intense anticipation

g606.definition: [ἀπόκειμαι] from {{g575}} and {{g2749}}; to be reserved; figuratively, to await

g609.definition: [ἀποκόπτω] from {{g575}} and {{g2875}}; to amputate; reflexively (by irony) to mutilate (the privy parts) Compare {{g2699}}.

g610.definition: [ἀπόκριμα] from {{g611}} (in its original sense of judging); a judicial decision

g611.definition: [ἀποκρίνομαι] from {{g575}} and κρίνω; to conclude for oneself, i.e. (by implication) to respond; by Hebraism (compare {{h6030}}) to begin to speak (where an address is expected)

g613.definition: [ἀποκρύπτω] from {{g575}} and {{g2928}}; to conceal away (i.e. fully); figuratively, to keep secret

g615.definition: [ἀποκτείνω] from {{g575}} and κτείνω (to slay); to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy

g616.definition: [ἀποκυέω] from {{g575}} and the base of {{g2949}}; to breed forth, i.e. (by transference) to generate (figuratively)

g618.definition: [ἀπολαμβάνω] from {{g575}} and {{g2983}}; to receive (specially, in full, or as a host); also to take aside

g619.definition: [ἀπόλαυσις] from a comparative of {{g575}} and λαύω (to enjoy); full enjoyment

g620.definition: [ἀπολείπω] from {{g575}} and {{g3007}}; to leave behind (passively, remain); by implication, to forsake

g621.definition: [ἀπολείχω] from {{g575}} and λείχω (to "lick"); to lick clean

g622.definition: [ἀπόλλυμι] from {{g575}} and the base of {{g3639}}; to destroy fully (reflexively, to perish, or lose), literally or figuratively

g623.definition: [Ἀπολλύων] active participle of {{g622}}; a destroyer (i.e. Satan)

g624.definition: [Ἀπολλωνία] from the pagan deity Ἀπόλλων (i.e. the sun; from {{g622}}); Apollonia, a place in Macedonia

g625.definition: [Ἀπολλῶς] probably from the same as {{g624}}; Apollos, an Israelite

g626.definition: [ἀπολογέομαι] middle voice from a compound of {{g575}} and {{g3056}}; to give an account (legal plea) of oneself, i.e. exculpate (self)

g627.definition: [ἀπολογία] from the same as {{g626}}; a plea ("apology")

g628.definition: [ἀπολούω] from {{g575}} and {{g3068}}; to wash fully, i.e. (figuratively) have remitted (reflexively)

g629.definition: [ἀπολύτρωσις] from a compound of {{g575}} and {{g3083}}; (the act) ransom in full, i.e. (figuratively) riddance, or (specially) Christian salvation

g630.definition: [ἀπολύω] from {{g575}} and {{g3089}}; to free fully, i.e. (literally) relieve, release, dismiss (reflexively, depart), or (figuratively) let die, pardon or (specially) divorce

g631.definition: [ἀπομάσσομαι] middle voice from {{g575}} and μάσσω (to squeeze, knead, smear); to scrape away

g632.definition: [ἀπονέμω] from {{g575}} and the base of {{g3551}}; to apportion, i.e. bestow

g633.definition: [ἀπονίπτω] from {{g575}} and {{g3538}}; to wash off (reflexively, one's own hands symbolically)

g635.definition: [ἀποπλανάω] from {{g575}} and {{g4105}}; to lead astray (figuratively); passively, to stray (from truth)

g638.definition: [ἀποπνίγω] from {{g575}} and {{g4155}}; to stifle (by drowning or overgrowth)

g639.definition: [ἀπορέω] from a compound of {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and the base of {{g4198}}; to have no way out, i.e. be at a loss (mentally)

g640.definition: [ἀπορία] from the same as {{g639}}; a (state of) quandary

g641.definition: [ἀποῤῥίπτω] from {{g575}} and {{g4496}}; to hurl off, i.e. precipitate (oneself)

g642.definition: [ἀπορφανίζω] from {{g575}} and a derivative of {{g3737}}; to bereave wholly, i.e. (figuratively) separate (from intercourse)

g643.definition: [ἀποσκευάζω] from {{g575}} and a derivative of {{g4632}}; to pack up (one's) baggage

g644.definition: [ἀποσκίασμα] from a compound of {{g575}} and a derivative of {{g4639}}; a shading off, i.e. obscuration

g645.definition: [ἀποσπάω] from {{g575}} and {{g4685}}; to drag forth, i.e. (literally) unsheathe (a sword), or relatively (with a degree of force implied) retire (personally or factiously)

g646.definition: [ἀποστασία] feminine of the same as {{g647}}; defection from truth (properly, the state) ("apostasy")

g647.definition: [ἀποστάσιον] neuter of a (presumed) adjective from a derivative of {{g868}}; properly, something separative, i.e. (specially) divorce

g648.definition: [ἀποστεγάζω] from {{g575}} and a derivative of {{g4721}}; to unroof

g649.definition: [ἀποστέλλω] from {{g575}} and {{g4724}}; set apart, i.e. (by implication) to send out (properly, on a mission) literally or figuratively

g650.definition: [ἀποστερέω] from {{g575}} and στερέω (to deprive); to despoil

g652.definition: [ἀπόστολος] from {{g649}}; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ ("apostle") (with miraculous powers)

g653.definition: [ἀποστοματίζω] from {{g575}} and a (presumed) derivative of {{g4750}}; to speak off-hand (properly, dictate), i.e. to catechize (in an invidious manner)

g654.definition: [ἀποστρέφω] from {{g575}} and {{g4762}}; to turn away or back (literally or figuratively)

g655.definition: [ἀποστυγέω] from {{g575}} and the base of {{g4767}}; to detest utterly

g657.definition: [ἀποτάσσομαι] middle voice from {{g575}} and {{g5021}}; literally, to say adieu (by departing or dismissing); figuratively, to renounce

g658.definition: [ἀποτελέω] from {{g575}} and {{g5055}}; to complete entirely, i.e. consummate

g659.definition: [ἀποτίθημι] from {{g575}} and {{g5087}}; to put away (literally or figuratively)

g660.definition: [ἀποτινάσσω] from {{g575}} and τινάσσω (to jostle); to brush off

g661.definition: [ἀποτίνω] from {{g575}} and {{g5099}}; to pay in full

g663.definition: [ἀποτομία] from the base of {{g664}}; (figuratively) decisiveness, i.e. rigor

g664.definition: [ἀποτόμως] adverb from a derivative of a comparative of {{g575}} and τέμνω (to cut); abruptly, i.e. peremptorily

g665.definition: [ἀποτρέπω] from {{g575}} and the base of {{g5157}}; to deflect, i.e. (reflexively) avoid

g666.definition: [ἀπουσία] from the participle of {{g548}}; a being away

g667.definition: [ἀποφέρω] from {{g575}} and {{g5342}}; to bear off (literally or relatively)

g669.definition: [ἀποφθέγγομαι] from {{g575}} and {{g5350}}; to enunciate plainly, i.e. declare

g670.definition: [ἀποφορτίζομαι] from {{g575}} and the middle voice of {{g5412}}; to unload

g671.definition: [ἀπόχρησις] from a compound of {{g575}} and {{g5530}}; the act of using up, i.e. consumption

g673.definition: [ἀποχωρίζω] from {{g575}} and {{g5563}}; to rend apart; reflexively, to separate

g674.definition: [ἀποψύχω] from {{g575}} and {{g5594}}; to breathe out, i.e. faint

g675.definition: [Ἄππιος] of Latin origin; (in the genitive, i.e. possessive case) of Appius, the name of a Roman

g676.definition: [ἀπρόσιτος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a derivative of a comparative of {{g4314}} and εἶμι (to go); inaccessible

g677.definition: [ἀπρόσκοπος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of {{g4350}}; actively, inoffensive, i.e. not leading into sin; passively, faultless, i.e. not led into sin

g678.definition: [ἀπροσωπολήπτως] adverb from a compound of {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of a presumed compound of {{g4383}} and {{g2983}} (compare {{g4381}}); in a way not accepting the person, i.e. impartially

g679.definition: [ἄπταιστος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a derivative of {{g4417}}; not stumbling, i.e. (figuratively) without sin

g680.definition: [ἅπτομαι] reflexive of {{g681}}; properly, to attach oneself to, i.e. to touch (in many implied relations)

g681.definition: [ἅπτω] a primary verb; properly, to fasten to, i.e. (specially) to set on fire

g682.definition: [Ἀπφία] probably of foreign origin; Apphia, a woman of Collosæ

g683.definition: [ἀπωθέομαι]   or ἀπώθομαιfrom {{g575}} and the middle voice of ὠθέω or ὤθω (to shove); to push off, figuratively, to reject

g684.definition: [ἀπώλεια] from a presumed derivative of {{g622}}; ruin or loss (physical, spiritual or eternal)

g685.definition: [ἀρά] probably from {{g142}}; properly, prayer (as lifted to Heaven), i.e. (by implication) imprecation

g686.definition: [ἄρα] probably from {{g142}} (through the idea of drawing a conclusion); a particle denoting an inference more or less decisive (as follows) Often used in connection with other particles, especially {{g1065}} or {{g3767}} (after) or {{g1487}} (before). Compare also {{g687}}.

g687.definition: [ἆρα] a form of {{g686}}, denoting an interrogation to which a negative answer is presumed

g688.definition: [Ἀραβία] of Hebrew origin ({{h6152}}); Arabia, a region of Asia

g689.definition: [Ἀράμ] of Hebrew origin ({{h7410}}); Aram (i.e. Ram), an Israelite

g690.definition: [Ἄραψ] from {{g688}}; an Arab or native of Arabia

g691.definition: [ἀργέω] from {{g692}}; to be idle, i.e. (figuratively) to delay

g692.definition: [ἀργός] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and {{g2041}}; inactive, i.e. unemployed; (by implication) lazy, useless

g694.definition: [ἀργύριον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g696}}; silvery, i.e. (by implication) cash; specially, a silverling (i.e. drachma or shekel)

g695.definition: [ἀργυροκόπος] from {{g696}} and {{g2875}}; a beater (i.e. worker) of silver

g696.definition: [ἄργυρος] from ἀργός (shining); silver (the metal, in the articles or coin)

g697.definition: [Ἄρειος Πάγος] from Ἄρης (the name of the Greek deity of war) and a derivative of {{g4078}}; rock of Ares, a place in Athens

g698.definition: [Ἀρεοπαγίτης] from {{g697}}; an Areopagite or member of the court held on Mars' Hill

g700.definition: [ἀρέσκω] probably from {{g142}} (through the idea of exciting emotion); to be agreeable (or by implication, to seek to be so)
